qas.question: Of what alliance is Tuvalu a member?
What is the AOSIS'S main concern?
To what agreement has Tuvalu committed?
What type of energy does the Majuro Declaration advocate?
By what means does Tuvalu plan to produce 95% of its energy?

context: Tuvalu participates in the <a0_0>Alliance of Small Island States<a0_0/> (AOSIS), which is a coalition of small island and low-lying coastal countries that have concerns about their vulnerability to the adverse effects of global <a1_0>climate change<a1_0/>. Under the <a2_0>Majuro Declaration<a2_0/>, which was signed on 5 September 2013, Tuvalu has commitment to implement power generation of <a3_0>100% renewable<a3_0/> energy (between 2013 and 2020), which is proposed to be implemented using <a4_0>Solar PV<a4_0/> (95% of demand) and biodiesel (5% of demand). The feasibility of wind power generation will be considered. Tuvalu participates in the operations of the Pacific Islands Applied Geoscience Commission (SOPAC) and the Secretariat of the Pacific Regional Environment Programme (SPREP).
